Replies.Reply: There was an accident. I came here.
I think so. I was just taking a shower.
The boys found this on the floor in back of the Caddy.
No. Could be someone's missin' maybe.
Nope, not yet. Their fingerprints don't match up anywhere.
Why did you want to go to breakfast if you're not hungry?
To Denny's? I wasn't going to say anything, but why Denny's?
Okay, so you had a dream about this place. Tell me.
So, you came to see if he's out there?
I just wanted to come here.
I had a dream about this place.
To get rid of this god-awful feeling.
Beads of sweat cover his face. He finds it difficult to breathe. Herb is just behind him unable to see the fear overtaking his friend, but Herb can feel something himself.
It's time to say goodbye, Betty. It's been so nice travelling with you.
Thank you, Irene. I was so excited and nervous. It was sure great to have you to talk to.
Okay Irene. Won't that be the day.
I am, Mrs. Lanois. It is Mrs. Lanois isn't it?
Yes, he is. He raises corn.
Have many famous actors and actresses lived here? I was meaning to ask you that.
I guess I've come to quite a place.
Oh Coco thank you. Thank you so much.
I'm Ruth's niece. My name's Betty. I'm sure she told you I was coming.
Oh my god. I'm sorry. I'll let you get back to that. I'm going to get unpacked.
I'm sorry. I'll get out of here and we can talk later.

She sure is. She's letting me stay here while she's working on a movie that's being made in Canada, but I guess you know that.  I couldn't afford a place like this in a million years. Unless of course I'm discovered and become a movie star. Of course, I'd rather be known as a great actress than a movie star, but sometimes people end up being both and that is, I guess you'd say, sort of why I came here. I'm sorry, I'm just so excited to be here..I mean I just came here from Iowa and now I'm in this dream place. You can imagine how I feel.
If you have a concussion you shouldn't sleep.
No Grandpa, you wouldn't believe it.
What do you mean? You're Rita.
This is your purse. Your name must be in your purse.
You want to know don't you?
How do you remember how to talk?
The money. You don't know where it came from?
I wonder where you were going.
Maybe that's where the accident was.
Come on. It'll be just like in the movies. We'll pretend to be someone else. I want to walk around anyway. I'm in Hollywood and I haven't even seen any of it. Come on Rita. Do you feel up to it?
Just to see if there was an accident on Mulholland Drive.
She's kind of a frumpy woman detective in British movies.
Try these on. You can wear one of my T-
No, no, I just want the number.
I'm inquiring about an accident that happened last night on Mulholland Drive.
Can you tell me what happened?
There was an accident. He wouldn't tell me anything else, but that was your accident Rita. I just know it was.
Maybe it happened so late it's not going to be in today's paper.
Just the coffee. Rita, you want something?
Maybe the voice isn't Diane Selwyn.
It's right about here on Sierra Bonita.
I know you're afraid of something. We'll be careful. Tomorrow we'll go over there and we'll find out.
Ruth's gone on a film. I'm her niece Betty.   Who are you?
I'm her niece. She's letting me stay here. My name is Betty.
Oh, no wonder I'm starving. I'm going to fix a sandwich. You want one?
You've got to eat something. You're just nervous about going over to see if you're Diane Selwyn.
Suit yourself. I'll share mine with you if you change your mind.
Not really. I met her in junior college and she was from this other town.
Everything is A-okay, but I've gotta get that sandwich!
And I've got an audition in one hour.
I hope I'm back in a couple of hours.
When I get back I'll have the cab waiting, so be ready to go.
No, no. I'm on my way to my audition.
Thanks Coco. I'll let you know.
My parents are right upstairs! They think you've left.
Thank you again, Mr. Brown. It was nice meeting all of you.
C'mom. There's nothing to be afraid of.
Why didn't you ask him? Sol knows you!
You're not going to get in trouble.
What is it? What do you see?!
Keep going. Go around to the back.
See, I told you there was nothing to be afraid of!
C'mon help me in. I'll open the front door.
I know what you have to do, but let me do it.
Hey, let's introduce the brand new you to Hollywood. We haven't seen the roof garden yet.
Here I am Hollywood! My name's Betty.
Now, remember I'll be watching for you on the big screen.
The best of luck to you, Betty. Take care of yourself and be careful.
Damn lot of corn raised in Hollywood these days too.
You don't have to tell me. It's written all over that pretty face of yours.. You came here to be an actress. I just hope you'll remember there's never been a great poem called "tits and ass."
You probably don't remember her, but Louise Bonner lives right over there in number 29. When she isn't drunk she runs a damn good acting class.
Honey, all the great ones came through here at one time or another.
People say in the springtime when the wind blows the smell of the jasmine you can still feel the presence of everyone of them.
Sweetheart, you don't know the half of it.
ONCE MORE OUT HERE AND I'LL BAKE HIS BUTT FOR BREAKFAST!!
You don't have pets do you?
Now I guess you and your Aunt have an understanding. So here's the key and you need anything, just give a holler.
Everybody in this building's pretty much okay with me or they wouldn't be here.
You got it! See you later honey.
This is Louise Bonner. I'm sure she meant well.
This is Betty, Ruth's niece. In fact and fortunately I was just coming to see Betty. Betty's a young actress and I'm delivering faxed pages of a scene for her audition tomorrow. Here they are honey.
Can I see you outside a minute Betty?
She wants to know who's staying in her apartment.
So I guess your Grandpa and Grandma know her.
Don't make me out to be a sucker. Louise Bonner says there's trouble in there.
It's all right gorgeous. Something wrong?
Naw! He wouldn't have cared. Just give him a good performance and he'll be happy and I've got a feeling you'll do just that.
Get going. You don't want to be late.
It will be okay if I sleep. I need to lie down and sleep.
I don't know who I am.
I'm not. I don't know what my name is.
Diane Selwyn. Maybe it's my name.
"I came back. I thought that's what you wanted."
"What about you? What will your dad think about you?"
Is everything all right? Is it bad for you that I'm here?
Those men in front, in the car.
Well, not much Ed. Just doin' some stuff for this guy.
Oh, things aren't so bad. Gee, I hope you're not goin' to get in any trouble.
Hey man. She's hurt bad. Get down here and use the phone. Help me out. You gotta call the hospital.
I mean it! Get down here quick! She's hurt and I can't do everything myself, man.
No, no, no. You gotta be turned around.
No, no, no, I told you. They're fine.
It must be just so pathetic being you.
You sure you don't want anything?
Sure, reach in my shirt pocket there.
Any new girls on the street these days?
You'll keep your eyes open for me won't you baby?
It was just a thing. The story made you laugh.
Yeah, the history of the world in phone numbers.
What girl? For what? What is this Ray?
Interest?! There's six of the top actresses that want this thing.
Hold on!!!!!!!! There's no way, there's no way!!!
Wait a minute!! What's going on here?
There's no way that girl is in my movie!
Hey!!!!! That girl is not in my film!!!
Did the Castigliane brothers get out of that limo?
I'm going home. I'll call you later.
Hello Taka. It's 'cause I'm never home in the day time. It's good to see you again. The garden looks great.
I don't know what's going on.
Fine. I'll check out in the morning.
Beverly Hills Hotel. I've got enough cash in my pocket for one night.
Oh, Jason thought it would be a good idea for me to meet the Cowboy. Should I wear my ten gallon hat and my six shooters?
And getting stranger. Where do I meet this Cowboy? I mean do I have to ride out to the range?
Yeah, sure. It is that kind of a day.
I understand, Cynthia and thank you for the offer. I'll find a place. Now go ahead and give the Cowboy a yodel and get back to me.
Git along little dowgie and call me back.
No problem. What's on your mind?
That a man's attitude determines to a large extent how his life will be.
So, this is the last time I see you then unless I do bad?
Thank you very much, Carol. It was really great of you to come in. I know how busy you are.
It'll be my pleasure. Now, get out of here.
Mr. Roque stares at Ray silently.
you told me they might insist on a girl, that's all.
It is no longer your film.
They two guys in dark suits?
The other car is here sirs. Please allow me.
Here's the key to the car. Take it straight to the garage. They're waiting for you.
You may go right in, Ray.
Good. Perfect timing. Have a seat and I'll get Mr. Brown.
Yeah, sure. Look what happened to them.
My next delivery is up that way, so I'll be getting down to it real soon.
Gotta keep an eye on her, that's all.
Keep her from gettin' in trouble, that's all.
Can we eat in the van?

A car - a late model generic sedan is moving toward us. Two men dressed in suits and wearing dark glasses are driving slowly. As they go each man is scanning sidewalks, buildings, passing cars as if hunting for someone. They pass by us and as we turn we leave them and pick-up Adam driving in the opposite direction in the other lane. We stay with Adam.
She's on the set. I'll connect you Mr.
Paul, I have Mr. Kesher for Cynthia.
Hold please. I'll connect you to traffic.
Right baby, all Hell's broke loose down here. I'll try to find her.
They've closed the set. They sent everybody home.
You've got to talk to Ray you've got to fix this.
Adam, this isn't like you. Please come to the office. There must be something we can do.
I know.  Where are you Adam?
Someone called me. When they couldn't get you they told me you were as good as broke. I didn't believe then, so I made some calls.
I know, but you're broke. Where are you?
Do you know somebody called the The Cowboy?
Yeah, the Cowboy. This guy, the Cowboy, wants to see you. Jason said he thought it would be a good idea.
Something tells me this guy is connected with what's happening, Adam, and I think you should do it and I think you should do it right away.
It's been a very strange day.
Sort of, funny boy. If I tell him the meeting's on you're to go to the top of Beachwood Canyon. There's a corral up there where he'll be.
I'm just offering a place to stay.
Okay, but you don't know what you're missing.
What the hell are you even doing here?
Just forget you ever saw it. It's better that way.
That's not a way to treat your wife, buddy. I don't care what she's done.
I guess you don't understand English.
May I have your name please?
You're welcome. Will that be all? You want your check?
Someone is in trouble. Who are you? Why are you in Ruth's apartment?
No it isn't. That's not it. That's not what she said. Something bad's happening.
Where have you been Coco? God, I've been trying to find you all afternoon since 3:00 o'clock. That one is in my room and she won't leave. I want you to get her out. I want you to get her out now.
No, she said it was someone else in trouble.
I'm sorry Mr. Kesher, but there seems to be some problem concerning your credit card.
The fact is Mr. Kesher a representative of your bank called us.
I don't know. All we do is take an impression of the credit card and until you check out it just sits in our files.
Well, Sir, I'm afraid they said you're overdrawn at your bank and your line of credit has been cancelled.
That's fine, Mr. Kesher. You can pay cash when you check out. I'm sorry. it was my duty to inform you.
Have a good evening, Mr. Kesher.
Sure want to thank ya for drivin' all the way up to see me from that Beverly Hills Hotel.
Well now, here's a man who wants to get right to it. Kinda anxious to get to it are ya?
So since you agree I guess you could be a person who does not care about the good life.
Well, just stop for a little second and think about it. Will ya do that for me?
No. You're too busy being a smart aleck to be thinkin'. Now I want ya to think and quit bein' such a smart aleck. Can ya do that for me?
There's sometimes a buggy. How many drivers does a buggy have?
So let's just say I'm drivin' this buggy and you fix your attitude and you can ride along with me.
You thinkin' this'll work out, cause I was thinkin' it just might.
Good then, but, just in case, that bank's gonna stay closed a bit longer. You understand that?
And where do we think we're going, Miss?
And who are we auditioning for today?
And do we know which of the fifty-seven buildings Wally Brown is in?
Well, now we've got to figure that out first don't we?
Mr.Wallace Brown is in the Executive Building on the second floor. We want to go in and turn right at the first street.
I'm Wally Brown. Your Aunt is a very dear friend of mine so it's particularly nice to meet you.
Come in. I'd like you to meet everyone.
I took the liberty of inviting an extra person to see your audition. She saw your resume picture and was very interested in meeting you.
Betty Elms this is Jack Taft, my assistant, Jimmy Katz who we've already cast for the part of "Chuck". He'll be doing the scene with you.
And this is Martha, Martha Johnson, who you met out front.
Well. Shall we get to it? Would you like a water or a coffee before we begin?
Well, thank you Betty, and I mean that.
Well, yes indeed. Our pleasure, Sarah, and don't you be a stranger. We'd love to see you around here again real soon.
Why thank you, Wally. Hello Betty.
I'm going to take her over there.
Thank you, Wally. I'm sure you all have a lot to talk about. We'll walk Betty out.
Oh, not you Betty. You were stellar and I mean that, but poor Wally. He'll never get that picture made. Wally's days were up twenty -years ago.
Oh god! Jimmy Katz never had a day.
Settle down, Betty. Don't get me wrong.

And I love actors, all actors, Jimmy Katz included. We just get a little catty sometimes. Now we want to take you across the way and introduce you to a director who's a head above the rest. He's got a project that you would kill!
Very good. Really. I mean it was forced maybe but still humanistic. Yeah, very good, really.
Just tell me where it hurts, baby.
I want to play this one close, Bob. Like it was with that girl, what's her name, with the black hair. That felt good.
Dad's best friend goes to work.
I came back. I thought that's what you wanted.
What about you? What will your dad think about you?
Then they'd put you in jail.
There it was it was! Baby, you got a way!
Oh, man, are you kidding? I love this script! Where do I sign?
Did you want to tell me something, Adam?
Yeah. Well, I haven't seen Sol lately.
It's kind of hidden by the foliage.
I'll go with you. She's still got some of my stuff.

We move off the door of Aunt Ruth's apartment and crane slowly up to the apartment above hers - WILKINS - the one with the wayward dog. We move closer to Wilkins' apartment and as we move in we hear a phone ringing.
Murphy and I'll be glad to see you. No, no, no, he's got plenty of food.
